snippet: Sixteen British medical students and young doctors left for Syria to join the Islamic State this year, after being recruited by a British medical student at a university in Sudan, the BBC reported on Friday.
abstract: BBC investigative report identifies former medical student Mohammed Fakhri al-Khabass, Briton of Palestinian descent, as recruiter for Islamic State who convinced two groups of medical students and young doctors from northeastern England to join group.

byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Sixteen British medical students and young doctors left for Syria to join the Islamic State this year, after being recruited by a British medical student at a university in Sudan, the BBC reported on Friday.

headline.main: Young Medics Were Lured by Briton to Join ISIS
headline.print_headline: Young Medics Were Lured by Briton to Join ISIS

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
